Comments_List: I learned about banking crises mainly and more generally about the role of the banks. Also I learned about macroprudential policies which are very important. The course was enlightening about the recent global financial crisis too.
I learned about macro-prudential policy, and the various drivers behind financial crises from two experts in the field

The strength of the course is that it combines theory and data and gives a broad view of banking crises and the role of the banks. 

The weakness of the course is that it focuses only on banks. There are other financial crises, such as sovereign debt crises, or currency crushes that create greater problems in an economy hit by such shocks than a banking crisis. We discussed very little about such events.
Yes, if a student is interested in banking and crises related to banks I will recommend it for sure.
Take it!! Dont be afraid as an undergrad, professors are super approachable and grading is very fair. It is a must take for anyone
